EventType.name: Issue Comment Edited
EventType.description: This is the 'issue comment edited' event.

EventType.name: Issue Worklog Updated
EventType.description: This is the 'issue worklog updated' event.

EventType.name: Issue Worklog Deleted
EventType.description: This is the 'issue worklog deleted' event.

EventType.name: Work Logged On Issue
EventType.description: This is the 'work logged on issue' event.

EventType.name: Work Started On Issue
EventType.description: This is the 'work started on issue' event.

EventType.name: Work Stopped On Issue
EventType.description: This is the 'work stopped on issue' event.

FieldConfigScheme.name: Default Issue Type Scheme
FieldConfigScheme.description: Default issue type scheme is the list of global issue types. All newly created issue types will automatically be added to this scheme.

FieldConfigScheme.name: TEST: Simple Issue Tracking Issue Type Scheme

FieldLayoutItem.description: For example operating system, software platform and/or hardware specifications (include as appropriate for the issue).

An estimate of how much work remains until this issue will be resolved.
The format of this is ' *w *d *h *m ' (representing weeks, days, hours and minutes - where * can be any number)
Examples: 4d, 5h 30m, 60m and 3w.
Allows work to be logged whilst creating, editing or transitioning issues.

FieldScreen.name: Default Screen
FieldScreen.description: Allows to update all system fields.

FieldScreen.name: Workflow Screen
FieldScreen.description: This screen is used in the workflow and enables you to assign issues

FieldScreen.name: Resolve Issue Screen
FieldScreen.description: Allows to set resolution, change fix versions and assign an issue.

IssueType.name: Bug
IssueType.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

IssueType.name: New Feature
IssueType.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.

IssueType.name: Task
IssueType.description: A task that needs to be done.

IssueType.name: Improvement
IssueType.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

IssueTypeScreenScheme.name: Default Issue Type Screen Scheme
IssueTypeScreenScheme.description: The default issue type screen scheme

PermissionScheme.name: Default Permission Scheme
PermissionScheme.description: This is the default Permission Scheme. Any new projects that are created will be assigned this scheme.

Priority.name: Blocker
Priority.description: Blocks development and/or testing work, production could not run.

Priority.name: Critical
Priority.description: Crashes, loss of data, severe memory leak.

Priority.name: Minor
Priority.description: Minor loss of function, or other problem where easy workaround is present.

Priority.name: Trivial
Priority.description: Cosmetic problem like misspelt words or misaligned text.

ProjectRole.name: Users
ProjectRole.description: A project role that represents users in a project

ProjectRole.name: Developers
ProjectRole.description: A project role that represents developers in a project

ProjectRole.name: Administrators
ProjectRole.description: A project role that represents administrators in a project

Resolution.name: Fixed
Resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

Resolution.name: Won't Fix
Resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.

Resolution.name: Duplicate
Resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.

Resolution.name: Incomplete
Resolution.description: The problem is not completely described.

Resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce
Resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.

Status.name: Open
Status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

Status.name: In Progress
Status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

Status.name: Reopened
Status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

Status.name: Resolved
Status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Status.name: Closed
Status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

Workflow.name: classic default workflow
Workflow.descriptor: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE workflow PUBLIC "-//OpenSymphony Group//DTD OSWorkflow 2.8//EN" "http://www.opensymphony.com/osworkflow/workflow_2_8.dtd"> <workflow> <meta name="jira.description">The classic JIRA default workflow</meta> <initial-actions> <action id="1" name="Create Issue"> <meta name="opsbar-sequence">0</meta> <meta name="jira.i18n.title">common.forms.create</meta> <validators> <validator name="" type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.PermissionValidator</arg> <arg name="permission">Create Issue</arg> </validator> </validators> <results> <unconditional-result old-status="Finished" status="Open" step="1"> <post-functions> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.IssueCreateFunction</arg> </function> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction</arg> <arg name="eventTypeId">1</arg> </function> </post-functions> </unconditional-result> </results> </action> </initial-actions> <common-actions> <action id="2" name="Close Issue" view="resolveissue"> <meta name="jira.i18n.submit">closeissue.close</meta> <meta name="opsbar-sequence">60</meta> <meta name="jira.i18n.description">closeissue.desc</meta> <meta name="jira.i18n.title">closeissue.title</meta> <restrict-to> <conditions type="AND"> <condition type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.PermissionCondition</arg> <arg name="permission">Resolve Issue</arg> </condition> <condition type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.PermissionCondition</arg> <arg name="permission">Close Issue</arg> </condition> </conditions> </restrict-to> <results> <unconditional-result old-status="Finished" status="Closed" step="6"> <post-functions> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueStatusFunction</arg> </function> name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction</arg> <arg name="eventTypeId">5</arg> </function> </post-functions> </unconditional-result> </results> </action> <action id="3" name="Reopen Issue" view="commentassign"> <meta name="jira.i18n.submit">issue.operations.reopen.issue</meta> <meta name="opsbar-sequence">80</meta> <meta <action id="4" name="Start Progress"> <meta name="opsbar-sequence">20</meta> <meta name="jira.i18n.title">startprogress.title</meta> <restrict-to> <conditions> <condition type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.AllowOnlyAssignee</arg> </condition> </conditions> </restrict-to> <results> <unconditional-result old-status="Finished" status="Underway" <action id="5" name="Resolve Issue" view="resolveissue"> <meta name="jira.i18n.submit">resolveissue.resolve</meta> <meta name="opsbar-sequence">40</meta> <meta name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.PermissionCondition</arg> <arg name="permission">Resolve Issue</arg> </condition> </conditions> </restrict-to> <results> <unconditional-result old-status="Finished" status="Resolved" step="4"> <post-functions> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueStatusFunction</arg> </function> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.misc.CreateCommentFunction</arg> </function> <function type="class"> <arg </common-actions> <steps> <step id="1" name="Open"> <meta name="jira.status.id">1</meta> <actions> <common-action id="4" /> <common-action id="5" /> <common-action id="2" /> </actions> </step> <step id="3" name="In Progress"> <meta name="jira.status.id">3</meta> <actions> <common-action id="5" /> <common-action id="2" /> <action id="301" name="Stop Progress"> <meta name="opsbar-sequence">20</meta> <meta name="jira.i18n.title">stopprogress.title</meta> <restrict-to> <conditions> <condition type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.AllowOnlyAssignee</arg> </condition> </conditions> </restrict-to> <results> <unconditional-result old-status="Finished" status="Assigned" step="1"> <post-functions> <function type="class"> <arg name="field.value"></arg> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction</arg> <arg name="field.name">resolution</arg> </function> <function type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueStatusFunction</arg> </function> <function </actions> </step> <step id="4" name="Resolved"> <meta name="jira.status.id">5</meta> <actions> <common-action id="3" /> <action id="701" name="Close Issue" view="commentassign"> <meta name="jira.i18n.submit">closeissue.close</meta> <meta name="opsbar-sequence">60</meta> <meta name="jira.i18n.description">closeissue.desc</meta> <meta name="jira.description">Closing an issue indicates there is no more work to be done on it, and it has been verified as complete.</meta> <meta name="jira.i18n.title">closeissue.title</meta> <restrict-to> <conditions> <condition type="class"> <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.condition.PermissionCondition</arg> <arg name="permission">Close Issue</arg> </condition> </conditions> </restrict-to> <results> </actions> </step> <step id="5" name="Reopened"> <meta name="jira.status.id">4</meta> <actions> <common-action id="5" /> <common-action id="2" /> <common-action id="4" /> </actions> </step> <step id="6" name="Closed"> <meta name="jira.status.id">6</meta> <meta name="jira.issue.editable">false</meta> <actions> <common-action id="3" /> </actions> </step> </steps> </workflow>
